file_content.text: Thanks for your help! It's that kind of unity that will win us this war!
What's this? Where's the doctor?
Jaen Kett refused to leave.
He wouldn't go.
He's taking care of about twenty orphans.
With the kids.
It's a bit of a long story, so I'll skip to the end. You're gonna need some boats.
That's a good question.
What is this? The doctor needs... has he gone insane? This is an awfully tall order.
Judging by what he's written here, soft-hearted Jaen has found every single orphan on that island to take care of. Figures.
You saw the situation--what do you think? Can we really get the doctor and the kids out of there, or should we just focus on the doctor himself?
Those children need help--rescue them and the doctor.
We can't leave anyone behind.
You're right. Division is death. We'll get those kids. You'd better believe we'll get those kids.
Good work finding the doctor. You can take your pay and go now. We'll handle it from here. Again, good work.
It was nothing.
Of course. Happy to serve--that's the spirit.
I do my best to serve.
Just doing my duty.
Of course. Don't we all? Yes, sir, duty is most important.
It pays, that's enough for me.
The money's good.
Heh. Right.
I couldn't let those children suffer.
It had to be done.
Of course not. Who could? Not me. Not the good doctor. No, sir.
Well, I have work to do. Children to save. Keep fighting the good fight!
The doctor is the only one you need. No sense wasting time or effort on non-essential personnel.
Forget the kids.
You're right. It's a tough choice to make, but we have to make it for the good of the Republic. We need Jaen Kett.
Good work--you found the doctor and assessed the situation, just like I asked. I'll start making the arrangements.
It was nothing.
Of course it wasn't. You were helping the cause. Doing your part. That's what I always like to see.
I do my best to serve.
Just doing my duty.
Yes! Duty is paramount! It's why we're all here.
It pays, that's enough for me.
The money's good.
Heh. Yes, good work always should.
I couldn't let soldiers die needlessly.
It had to be done.
Yes--we need all the men we have. We need unity! And Jaen Kett will certainly help us achieve it.
Well, I should go. Much to be done, and a doctor to be rescued! Keep up the good work!
Republic soldiers are dying in the fields. We need that doctor!
Damn separatists. All they're doing is cutting themselves off. Cockeyed fools, all of them. Did you hear about the bridge to Mannett Point?
I hadn't heard. What happened to it?
No.
The separatists blew it up!
Is this some kind of test? Because I'm no good at tests.
I don't know.
No, of course it's not a test. Why would I test you? I don't believe in tests. They create division.
Damn separatists destroyed the bridge.
Yeah, I heard.
Got that right.
I heard twelve men and three rancors died building it.
Maybe.
I detect a bit of attitude there. I don't like it. These are trying times, and we all need to band together, for the good of Ord Mantell.
It's division that will bring us down--like the channel that divides Mannett Point from the rest of Avilatan island.
Those foolish separatists think that by blowing up the bridge to Mannett Point they're striking a blow for the people, but all they've created is division. And division is death.
So what're you doing?
Separatists can rot for all I care. Problem is, it isn't only separatists on that island.
Build another bridge and stop bugging me about it.
So make a new one.
Can't build a new bridge because the separatists hold the point.
I get it already.
Lots of good people got stuck in Mannett Point when the bridge went out. The separatists are trying to divide us. Divide and conquer, right?
There was a doctor there--Jaen Kett. Brilliant medical man and staunch Republic supporter. Essential to our effort. We need someone with the know-how to find him.
Let me help.
It's my duty to help the Republic win this war.
What can I do?
That's the spirit. Volunteering--I like it. Breeds unity.
Would you pay someone with the know-how?
Are you offering money?
Doctor Kett is worth a lot to the Republic. Of course we'll pay.
Boring.
Too bad. You look like the kind who can fight your way through a mess. Think about it. After all, you'll be serving the Republic, and the pay's good.
Deal.
That's right. Good old-fashioned zeal--so few people have it these days. Good to see it.
Now's a bad time.
Just hear me out. It'll be worth your time, I promise.
You tell me what to do, and I'll think about it.
I'll consider it.
It's not going to be easy, I can tell you that much.
Like I said, last contact we had with the good doctor he was on Mannett Point. Seeing as the bridge is out, you'll have to swim the channel.
And you'll want to watch out for separatists on the shore. If you have any luck finding the doctor, try to get him back here. Think you can handle it?
Don't worry about me.
One doctor, coming right up!
Right away.
Well, since you've promised to pay.
The price is right.
Great. That's the spirit. You know, I think we've got a chance at winning this thing.
Now, hurry up to Mannett Point. We haven't a moment to lose!
We need to stick together if we're gonna win this war. It's the only way.
